intro: Neobotrydium graveolens, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from purple to white. It produces berries that are toxic to humans and animals, containing alkaloids that can be harmful. Despite its toxicity, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
